00044 /*
00045  * Notice, all the functions below (except for lod_procfs_init() and
00046  * lod_procfs_fini()) are not supposed to be used directly. They are
00047  * called by Linux kernel's procfs.
00048  */

00061 static int lod_stripesize_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *v)
00062 {
00063         struct obd_device *dev = m->private;
00064         struct lod_device *lod;
00065 
00066         LASSERT(dev != NULL);
00067         lod  = lu2lod_dev(dev->obd_lu_dev);
00068         seq_printf(m, LPU64"\n",
00069                    lod->lod_desc.ld_default_stripe_size);
00070         return 0;
00071 }
00072 
00086 static ssize_t
00087 lod_stripesize_seq_write(struct file *file, const char __user *buffer,
00088                          size_t count, loff_t *off)
00089 {
00090         struct seq_file *m = file->private_data;
00091         struct obd_device *dev = m->private;
00092         struct lod_device *lod;
00093         __s64 val;
00094         int rc;
00095 
00096         LASSERT(dev != NULL);
00097         lod  = lu2lod_dev(dev->obd_lu_dev);
00098         rc = lprocfs_str_to_s64(buffer, count, &val);
00099         if (rc)
00100                 return rc;
00101         if (val < 0)
00102                 return -ERANGE;
00103 
00104         lod_fix_desc_stripe_size(&val);
00105         lod->lod_desc.ld_default_stripe_size = val;
00106 
00107         return count;
00108 }
00109 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS(lod_stripesize);

00202 static ssize_t
00203 lod_stripetype_seq_write(struct file *file, const char __user *buffer,
00204                          size_t count, loff_t *off)
00205 {
00206         struct seq_file *m = file->private_data;
00207         struct obd_device *dev = m->private;
00208         struct lod_device *lod;
00209         int rc;
00210         __u32 pattern;
00211         __s64 val;
00212 
00213         LASSERT(dev != NULL);
00214         lod  = lu2lod_dev(dev->obd_lu_dev);
00215         rc = lprocfs_str_to_s64(buffer, count, &val);
00216         if (rc)
00217                 return rc;
00218         if (val < 0)
00219                 return -ERANGE;
00220 
00221         pattern = val;
00222         lod_fix_desc_pattern(&pattern);
00223         lod->lod_desc.ld_pattern = pattern;
00224 
00225         return count;
00226 }
00227 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS(lod_stripetype);

00366 static int lod_qos_priofree_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *v)
00367 {
00368         struct obd_device *dev = m->private;
00369         struct lod_device *lod = lu2lod_dev(dev->obd_lu_dev);
00370 
00371         LASSERT(lod != NULL);
00372         seq_printf(m, "%d%%\n",
00373                    (lod->lod_qos.lq_prio_free * 100 + 255) >> 8);
00374         return 0;
00375 }
00376 
00393 static ssize_t
00394 lod_qos_priofree_seq_write(struct file *file, const char __user *buffer,
00395                            size_t count, loff_t *off)
00396 {
00397         struct seq_file *m = file->private_data;
00398         struct obd_device *dev = m->private;
00399         struct lod_device *lod;
00400         int rc;
00401         __s64 val;
00402 
00403         LASSERT(dev != NULL);
00404         lod = lu2lod_dev(dev->obd_lu_dev);
00405 
00406         rc = lprocfs_str_to_s64(buffer, count, &val);
00407         if (rc)
00408                 return rc;
00409 
00410         if (val < 0 || val > 100)
00411                 return -EINVAL;
00412         lod->lod_qos.lq_prio_free = (val << 8) / 100;
00413         lod->lod_qos.lq_dirty = 1;
00414         lod->lod_qos.lq_reset = 1;
00415 
00416         return count;
00417 }
00418 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS(lod_qos_priofree);
00419

00437                    (lod->lod_qos.lq_threshold_rr * 100 + 255) >> 8);

00458 static ssize_t
00459 lod_qos_thresholdrr_seq_write(struct file *file, const char __user *buffer,
00460                               size_t count, loff_t *off)
00461 {
00462         struct seq_file *m = file->private_data;
00463         struct obd_device *dev = m->private;
00464         struct lod_device *lod;
00465         int rc;
00466         __s64 val;
00467 
00468         LASSERT(dev != NULL);
00469         lod = lu2lod_dev(dev->obd_lu_dev);
00470 
00471         rc = lprocfs_str_with_units_to_s64(buffer, count, &val, '%');
00472         if (rc)
00473                 return rc;
00474 
00475         if (val > 100 || val < 0)
00476                 return -EINVAL;
00477 
00478         lod->lod_qos.lq_threshold_rr = (val << 8) / 100;
00479         lod->lod_qos.lq_dirty = 1;
00480 
00481         return count;
00482 }
00483 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS(lod_qos_thresholdrr);

00505 
00517 static ssize_t
00518 lod_qos_maxage_seq_write(struct file *file, const char __user *buffer,
00519                          size_t count, loff_t *off)
00520 {
00521         struct seq_file *m = file->private_data;
00522         struct obd_device *dev = m->private;
00523         struct lustre_cfg_bufs bufs;
00524         struct lod_device *lod;
00525         struct lu_device *next;
00526         struct lustre_cfg *lcfg;
00527         char str[32];
00528         unsigned int i;
00529         int rc;
00530         __s64 val;
00531 
00532         LASSERT(dev != NULL);
00533         lod = lu2lod_dev(dev->obd_lu_dev);
00534 
00535         rc = lprocfs_str_to_s64(buffer, count, &val);
00536         if (rc)
00537                 return rc;
00538 
00539         if (val <= 0)
00540                 return -EINVAL;
00541         lod->lod_desc.ld_qos_maxage = val;
00542 
00543         /*
00544          * propogate the value down to OSPs
00545          */
00546         lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(&bufs, NULL);
00547         snprintf(str, 32, "%smaxage=%u", PARAM_OSP, (__u32)val);
00548         lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&bufs, 1, str);
00549         lcfg = lustre_cfg_new(LCFG_PARAM, &bufs);
00550         if (lcfg == NULL)
00551                 return -ENOMEM;
00552 
00553         lod_getref(&lod->lod_ost_descs);
00554         lod_foreach_ost(lod, i) {
00555                 next = &OST_TGT(lod,i)->ltd_ost->dd_lu_dev;
00556                 rc = next->ld_ops->ldo_process_config(NULL, next, lcfg);
00557                 if (rc)
00558                         CERROR("can't set maxage on #%d: %d\n", i, rc);
00559         }
00560         lod_putref(lod, &lod->lod_ost_descs);
00561         lustre_cfg_free(lcfg);
00562 
00563         return count;
00564 }
00565 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS(lod_qos_maxage);
00566 
00567 static void *lod_osts_seq_start(struct seq_file *p, loff_t *pos)
00568 {
00569         struct obd_device *dev = p->private;
00570         struct lod_device *lod;
00571 
00572         LASSERT(dev != NULL);
00573         lod = lu2lod_dev(dev->obd_lu_dev);
00574 
00575         lod_getref(&lod->lod_ost_descs); /* released in lod_osts_seq_stop */
00576         if (*pos >= lod->lod_ost_bitmap->size)
00577                 return NULL;
00578 
00579         *pos = find_next_bit(lod->lod_ost_bitmap->data,
00580                                  lod->lod_ost_bitmap->size, *pos);
00581         if (*pos < lod->lod_ost_bitmap->size)
00582                 return OST_TGT(lod,*pos);
00583         else
00584                 return NULL;
00585 }
00586 
00587 static void lod_osts_seq_stop(struct seq_file *p, void *v)
00588 {
00589         struct obd_device *dev = p->private;
00590         struct lod_device *lod;
00591 
00592         LASSERT(dev != NULL);
00593         lod = lu2lod_dev(dev->obd_lu_dev);
00594         lod_putref(lod, &lod->lod_ost_descs);
00595 }
00596 
00597 static void *lod_osts_seq_next(struct seq_file *p, void *v, loff_t *pos)
00598 {
00599         struct obd_device *dev = p->private;
00600         struct lod_device *lod = lu2lod_dev(dev->obd_lu_dev);
00601 
00602         if (*pos >= lod->lod_ost_bitmap->size - 1)
00603                 return NULL;
00604 
00605         *pos = find_next_bit(lod->lod_ost_bitmap->data,
00606                                  lod->lod_ost_bitmap->size, *pos + 1);
00607         if (*pos < lod->lod_ost_bitmap->size)
00608                 return OST_TGT(lod,*pos);
00609         else
00610                 return NULL;
00611 }
00612 
00622 static int lod_osts_seq_show(struct seq_file *p, void *v)
00623 {
00624         struct obd_device   *obd = p->private;
00625         struct lod_ost_desc *ost_desc = v;
00626         struct lod_device   *lod;
00627         int                  idx, rc, active;
00628         struct dt_device    *next;
00629         struct obd_statfs    sfs;
00630 
00631         LASSERT(obd->obd_lu_dev);
00632         lod = lu2lod_dev(obd->obd_lu_dev);
00633 
00634         idx = ost_desc->ltd_index;
00635         next = OST_TGT(lod,idx)->ltd_ost;
00636         if (next == NULL)
00637                 return -EINVAL;
00638 
00639         /* XXX: should be non-NULL env, but it's very expensive */
00640         active = 1;
00641         rc = dt_statfs(NULL, next, &sfs);
00642         if (rc == -ENOTCONN) {
00643                 active = 0;
00644                 rc = 0;
00645         } else if (rc)
00646                 return rc;
00647 
00648         seq_printf(p, "%d: %s %sACTIVE\n", idx,
00649                    obd_uuid2str(&ost_desc->ltd_uuid),
00650                    active ? "" : "IN");
00651         return 0;
00652 }
00653 
00654 static const struct seq_operations lod_osts_sops = {
00655         .start  = lod_osts_seq_start,
00656         .stop   = lod_osts_seq_stop,
00657         .next   = lod_osts_seq_next,
00658         .show   = lod_osts_seq_show,
00659 };
00660 
00661 static int lod_osts_seq_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
00662 {
00663         struct seq_file *seq;
00664         int rc;
00665 
00666         rc = seq_open(file, &lod_osts_sops);
00667         if (rc)
00668                 return rc;
00669 
00670         seq = file->private_data;
00671         seq->private = PDE_DATA(inode);
00672         return 0;
00673 }

00693 static int lod_lmv_failout_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *v)
00694 {
00695         struct obd_device *dev = m->private;
00696         struct lod_device *lod;
00697 
00698         LASSERT(dev != NULL);
00699         lod = lu2lod_dev(dev->obd_lu_dev);
00700 
00701         seq_printf(m, "%d\n", lod->lod_lmv_failout ? 1 : 0);
00702         return 0;

00720 static ssize_t
00721 lod_lmv_failout_seq_write(struct file *file, const char __user *buffer,
00722                           size_t count, loff_t *off)
00723 {
00724         struct seq_file *m = file->private_data;
00725         struct obd_device *dev = m->private;
00726         struct lod_device *lod;
00727         __s64 val = 0;
00728         int rc;
00729 
00730         LASSERT(dev != NULL);
00731         lod = lu2lod_dev(dev->obd_lu_dev);
00732 
00733         rc = lprocfs_str_to_s64(buffer, count, &val);
00734         if (rc)
00735                 return rc;
00736 
00737         lod->lod_lmv_failout = !!val;
00738 
00739         return count;
00740 }
00741 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS(lod_lmv_failout);

00781 static const struct file_operations lod_proc_target_fops = {
00782         .owner   = THIS_MODULE,
00783         .open    = lod_osts_seq_open,
00784         .read    = seq_read,
00785         .llseek  = seq_lseek,
00786         .release = lprocfs_seq_release,
00787 };
00788 
00797 int lod_procfs_init(struct lod_device *lod)
00798 {
00799         struct obd_device       *obd = lod2obd(lod);
00800         struct proc_dir_entry   *lov_proc_dir = NULL;
00801         struct obd_type         *type;
00802         int                      rc;
00803 
00804         obd->obd_vars = lprocfs_lod_obd_vars;
00805         rc = lprocfs_obd_setup(obd);
00806         if (rc) {
00807                 CERROR("%s: cannot setup procfs entry: %d\n",
00808                        obd->obd_name, rc);
00809                 RETURN(rc);
00810         }
00811 
00812         rc = lprocfs_add_vars(obd->obd_proc_entry, lprocfs_lod_osd_vars,
00813                               &lod->lod_dt_dev);
00814         if (rc) {
00815                 CERROR("%s: cannot setup procfs entry: %d\n",
00816                        obd->obd_name, rc);
00817                 GOTO(out, rc);
00818         }
00819 
00820         rc = lprocfs_seq_create(obd->obd_proc_entry, "target_obd",
00821                                 0444, &lod_proc_target_fops, obd);
00822         if (rc) {
00823                 CWARN("%s: Error adding the target_obd file %d\n",
00824                       obd->obd_name, rc);
00825                 GOTO(out, rc);
00826         }
00827 
00828         lod->lod_pool_proc_entry = lprocfs_register("pools",
00829                                                     obd->obd_proc_entry,
00830                                                     NULL, NULL);
00831         if (IS_ERR(lod->lod_pool_proc_entry)) {
00832                 rc = PTR_ERR(lod->lod_pool_proc_entry);
00833                 lod->lod_pool_proc_entry = NULL;
00834                 CWARN("%s: Failed to create pool proc file: %d\n",
00835                       obd->obd_name, rc);
00836                 GOTO(out, rc);
00837         }
00838 
00839         /* If the real LOV is present which is the case for setups
00840          * with both server and clients on the same node then use
00841          * the LOV's proc root */
00842         type = class_search_type(LUSTRE_LOV_NAME);
00843         if (type != NULL && type->typ_procroot != NULL)
00844                 lov_proc_dir = type->typ_procroot;
00845         else
00846                 lov_proc_dir = obd->obd_type->typ_procsym;
00847 
00848         if (lov_proc_dir == NULL)
00849                 RETURN(0);
00850 
00851         /* for compatibility we link old procfs's LOV entries to lod ones */
00852         lod->lod_symlink = lprocfs_add_symlink(obd->obd_name, lov_proc_dir,
00853                                                "../lod/%s", obd->obd_name);
00854         if (lod->lod_symlink == NULL)
00855                 CERROR("cannot create LOV symlink for /proc/fs/lustre/lod/%s\n",
00856                        obd->obd_name);
00857         RETURN(0);
00858 
00859 out:
00860         lprocfs_obd_cleanup(obd);
00861 
00862         return rc;
00863 }
00864 
00870 void lod_procfs_fini(struct lod_device *lod)
00871 {
00872         struct obd_device *obd = lod2obd(lod);
00873 
00874         if (lod->lod_symlink != NULL) {
00875                 lprocfs_remove(&lod->lod_symlink);
00876                 lod->lod_symlink = NULL;
00877         }
00878 
00879         if (lod->lod_pool_proc_entry != NULL) {
00880                 lprocfs_remove(&lod->lod_pool_proc_entry);
00881                 lod->lod_pool_proc_entry = NULL;
00882         }
00883 
00884         lprocfs_obd_cleanup(obd);
00885 }
00886 
00887 #endif /* CONFIG_PROC_FS */
